meanings.definition: To take back possession of something, especially after nonpayment.
meanings.sent1: The bank is repossessing the car from the person who didn't pay for it.
meanings.sent2: She repossessed her bike from the neighbor who borrowed it and never returned it.
meanings.sent3: The cat was repossessing its favorite toy from the playful puppy.
meanings.sent4: The detective was repossessing the stolen jewels from the cunning thief.
meanings.sent5: The landlord repossessing the apartment from the tenant who broke the lease agreement.

meanings.definition: The act of reclaiming ownership of property due to default on payments.
meanings.sent1: The repossessing of the house happened swiftly after the missed mortgage payments.
meanings.sent2: After the repossession, the bank put the car up for sale.
meanings.sent3: The repossessing of the antique vase was a topic of gossip in the small town.
meanings.sent4: The repossessing of the land led to a legal dispute between the two parties.
meanings.sent5: The repossessing of the artwork was a relief to the museum curator.
